body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.26-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82683 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjsiodjsnodjsonjsio@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.2 / Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Workspace is on Control plan. - User has invited member B to the workspace. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace settings > Workflows. 3. Open the default workflow. 4. Edit the existing workflow and make member B be the second approver. 5. Go to workspace settings > Members. 6. Enter user C email and select the user > Next. 7. On confirm page, click Approver and select User B. 8. Click Invite member. 9. Go to workspace settings > Workflows. 10. Delete the second workflow. 11. Go to workspace settings > Members. 12. Click Invite member. 13. Enter any email > select user > Next. → Approver field is missing on confirm page. 14. Go to Workflows and go back to Members. 15. Repeat Step 12 and 13. → Approver field is shown now. ## Expected Result: In Step 13, after deleting workflow and inviting member, Approver field will be shown on confirm page because the default workflow has second approver. ## Actual Result: In Step 13, after deleting workflow and inviting member, Approver field is missing on confirm page. In Step 15, it only reappears after opening Workflows and reinviting member. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/36580443-059b-4f2e-9aa1-17ba94893d98 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: Help Wanted

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Needs subscription/card transaction) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @MitchExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771979206082789) ## Action Performed: 1. Created a new expense for an Expensify subscription billed at $45.00 USD. 2. Credit card was charged C$62.85. 3. Manually entered C$62.85 as the expense amount (to match the actual credit card charge). 4. Attached the receipt showing the $45.00 USD billing amount. 5. Saved the expense to a report. 6. Exported the report to a spreadsheet. ## Expected Result: The exported report should display C$62.85, exactly matching the manually entered amount and the credit card charge. No additional currency conversion or tax recalculation should occur during export. ## Actual Result: The exported report displays the amount as C$85.63 instead of C$62.85. The system appears to convert the manually entered amount, resulting in an inflated exported value. A warning message also appears stating “Amount greater than scanned receipt,” suggesting the system is misinterpreting the entered currency and applying unintended conversion logic. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The screenshot for the issue is in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771979206082789) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Rename `Move expense` to `Move to report`

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
**Original issue:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/604155 ## Problem The bulk action button labeled `Move expense` in NewDot is unclear; users don't realize it's how to add selected expenses to a report. **User session showing confusion:** https://fsty.io/v/BjSvdFes ## Expected Behavior Rename the action to `Move to report` while keeping the existing menu behavior: - Select an existing report - Create a new report - Remove expenses from a report (move to unreported) ## Solution — Label Change Only Update the `moveExpenses` translation key in `src/languages/en.ts` and `src/languages/es.ts` (and corresponding docs) to say "Move to report" instead of "Move expense(s)". No functional changes needed. ### Files to Change **Code (translation strings):** 1. `src/languages/en.ts:1494` — Change `moveExpenses: () => ({one: 'Move expense', other: 'Move expenses'})` → `moveExpenses: () => ({one: 'Move to report', other: 'Move to report'})` 2. `src/languages/es.ts:1328` — Change `moveExpenses: () => ({one: 'Mover gasto', other: 'Mover gastos'})` → Update with appropriate Spanish translation (e.g., `Mover a informe`) **Docs (references to "Move expense(s)" as a button label):** 3. `docs/articles/new-expensify/reports-and-expenses/Managing-Expenses-in-a-Report.md` — Update references like "**Move expense(s)**" to "**Move to report**" 4. Other docs files referencing the button label: `Getting-Started-with-the-Reports-Page.md`, `Delete-Expenses.md`, `Edit-Expense-Reports.md`, `Understanding-Report-Statuses-and-Actions.md` **No changes needed in these files** (they reference the translation key, which remains `iou.moveExpenses`): - `src/hooks/useSelectedTransactionsActions.ts:351` - `src/pages/Search/SearchPage.tsx:1011` - `src/pages/iou/request/step/IOURequestEditReportCommon.tsx:311` ### Open Questions - Should `moveUnreportedExpense` (line 1382: "Move unreported expense") also be renamed for consistency? - Should `moveToPersonalSpace` (line 1210: "Move expenses to your personal space") be updated similarly? - Confirm the Spanish translation — "Mover a informe" is the direct translation; the team may prefer different phrasing.
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @ikevin127

title: [$250] Fix race conditions and redundant writes in OnyxDerived initialisation

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from proposal [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1771853495488139) ### Background: On app startup, OnyxDerived/index.ts initialises derived Onyx values — computed values that depend on multiple Onyx stores. For each derived key, it attempts to restore a cached value from disk, falls back to an eager computation via tupleGet, and sets up connectWithoutView listeners (one per dependency) to recompute whenever dependencies change. Derived configs like reportAttributes use the areAllConnectionsSet context flag to decide whether to run a full computation or return an empty default. ### Problem: The initialisation flow has three race conditions and correctness issues: 1.  tupleGet overwrites fresher connection data: tupleGet is a Promise that resolves asynchronously. Meanwhile, connectWithoutView callbacks can fire before tupleGet resolves, writing fresher data to dependencyValues via setDependencyValue. When tupleGet finally resolves, it replaces the entire dependencyValues array reference (dependencyValues = values), discarding any fresher values that connection callbacks already wrote. Those values won't be restored until the dependency changes again. 2. tupleGet computes with uninitialised data: The tupleGet callback calls compute(dependencyValues, ...) before assigning dependencyValues = values, so the initial computation always runs on an array of undefined values. Additionally, it passes areAllConnectionsSet: false in the context, causing compute functions like reportAttributes to short-circuit and return empty defaults ({reports: {}, locale: null}), making the entire tupleGet path produce useless output. 3. Disk-cached value immediately overwritten: When a derived value IS restored from disk, the code proceeds to set up connection listeners. Each listener triggers recomputeDerivedValue → compute → Onyx.set. Since areAllConnectionsSet is false until all N connections fire, compute functions return empty defaults. This immediately overwrites the valid disk-cached value with {reports: {}, locale: null}, causing a flash of empty data. This produces N-1 unnecessary Onyx.set calls per derived key during initialisation — all writing empty defaults. ### Solution: 1. Remove tupleGet entirely: Since connection callbacks already populate dependencyValues incrementally and recomputeDerivedValue can defer until all connections are ready, tupleGet is redundant. The first full computation happens naturally when the last connection fires. 2. Defer Onyx.set until all connections are established: Add an early return in recomputeDerivedValue when areAllConnectionsSet is false. Dependency values still accumulate correctly via setDependencyValue, but no compute or Onyx write occurs until the last connection initialises. This prevents overwriting disk-cached values with empty defaults and eliminates N-1 wasted writes. Performance Gains: - Cold Start -> 14.7s - 13.3s (-9.5%) - Warm Start -> 1.5s - 1.3s (-13.3%)
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @shubham1206agra
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~022026567465536380599
  • Upwork Job ID: 2026567465536380599
  • Last Price Increase: 2026-02-25

    • linhvovan29546 | Contributor | 110577445

Create an expense in self DM. 2. Create an expense in workspace chat. 3. Open the expense report in the workspace chat. 4. Click More > Merge. 5. Select self DM expense > Continue. 6. Select all the details from self DM expense (second option in each section) > Next. 7. Click Merge expenses. 8. You should be redirected to self-dm 9. Press the back button in the app. ## Expected Result: The message “Hmm... it’s not here” is displayed, and the user is unable to return back. ## Actual Result: After pressing the back button, the user should be navigated back normally, and “Hmm... it’s not here” message should not displayed. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/41174aad-d60f-4c41-810a-a342ec1afb09 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @truph01

body:
## Background Coming from [this convo](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1771366669073939), we'd like to make a **global change** to the **date picker** in New Expensify for improved usability. ## Current example ## Proposed update See below, but **note these details:** - Arrows go back/forward for month and year - Clicking on the actual month name **or** year name launches the RHP pickers cc @shawnborton @JmillsExpensify for viz since we were discussing this
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @Ollyws

Observe the column mapping dropdown options ## Expected Result: The column mapping dropdown should include the ability to map: Custom Field 1 Custom Field 2 Approval Limit Over Limit Forward To This should match the functionality available in Expensify Classic. ## Actual Result: These fields are not available in the mapping dropdown. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/30aafbc9-9946-4371-a149-72b668af1899 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.25-13 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @abbagail **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771888614344279) ## Action Performed: ## Problem: Currently, when category or tag-level approvers are configured, there is no way to see them at a glance in the list view. To determine whether a category or tag has an approver assigned, users must: Click into each individual category or tag Inspect the approver setting manually ## Expected Result: Admins can quickly see which categories/tags have approvers assigned. ## Actual Result: To determine whether a category or tag has an approver assigned, users must: Click into each individual category or tag ## Workaround: Unknown ## Requested Enhancement Add an “Approver” column to: Category list view Tag list view Column should display: Assigned approver (if present) Empty/null if none set This column would only appear if: The workspace has category/tag approvers enabled. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0be34746-85a6-4928-bbdf-85d0f5e1eee9 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
